moves.11. Qxb7 Bxf3: The annotation started here, as he or she wrote, "Hardicsay had won a game a few months before after 12.gxf3 Nh5, when Black has good compensation for the sacrificed pawn after either 13.Be3 Nd7 or 13.Bg3 Nxg3 14.hxg3 Nd7."
moves.12... Nxe4 13. Rc1: ! This was a theoretical novelty; Black had been thought to be better after 13.Nxe4 Bxe4.
moves.13... Bd4: After 13...Nxc3 14.bxc3 Be4 15.f3 Bf5 16.g4, Black would have no good retreat for his bishop, e.g. 16...Bd7 17.Bxd6.
moves.14. Rc2 Nxf2: ?! 14...Nxc3 15.gxf3! also leaves White with a large advantage.
moves.19. Bh6+ Kg8 20. Re7: ! Paralyzing Black and stopping any counterplay with ...Qh4+. The rook is immune because 20...Qxe7 21.Qxb8+ forces mate.
moves.21... Qxb8 22. Ne4: Although Black is up a queen for a knight, he cannot stop 23.Nf6#.
